question: A man borrows 21000 Rs. at 10% compound interest. How much he has to pay annually at the end of each year, to settle his loan in two years?
explanation:
If each instalment be x, then present worth of first instalment
$latex = \\frac{x}{1+\\frac{10}{100}} = \\frac{10x}{11}&s=1$
Present worth of second instalment
$latex = \\frac{x}{\\left ( 1+\\frac{10}{100} \\right )^{2}} = \\frac{100x}{121}&s=1$
$latex \\therefore \\frac{10x}{11}+\\frac{100x}{121}=21000&s=1$
$latex => \\frac{110x+100x}{121} = 21000&s=1$
$latex => 210x = 21000\\times 121&s=1$
$latex => x = \\frac{21000\\times 121}{210} = 12100\\ Rs.&s=1$
Hence option [B] is correct answer.
